analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.noSessions: No work sessions recorded yet. Start a timer to track your work time.

tasksTab.creatingList1: Click the + icons at the top of the sub-sidebar to create a new task or folder.
tasksTab.creatingList2: Press <kbd>n</kbd> (when not typing) to quickly add a new task to the Inbox.
tasksTab.creatingList3: Folders can be nested up to 5 levels deep. Tasks can be placed anywhere.
tasksTab.organizingList1: Reorder: Drag a task/folder to change its position among siblings.
tasksTab.organizingList2: Move into folder: Drag a task onto a folder to nest it inside.
tasksTab.detailsList1: Click a task to view its detail panel on the right.
tasksTab.detailsList2: Edit the title inline, add a rich-text memo, set a scheduled date, or adjust the work duration.
tasksTab.detailsList3: The play button starts a focused timer session for that task.
tasksTab.detailsList4: Press <kbd>{{mod}} + Enter</kbd> to toggle a task between completed and incomplete.
tasksTab.detailsList5: Use <kbd>Tab</kbd> / <kbd>{{shift}} + Tab</kbd> to indent or outdent a task in the tree.
tasksTab.foldersList1: Folders group related tasks. Select a folder to change its color.
tasksTab.foldersList2: Folder colors are inherited by child tasks in Calendar and Analytics views.
tasksTab.softDeleteList1: Deleting a task moves it to the trash (soft delete).
tasksTab.softDeleteList2: Go to Settings → Trash to restore or permanently delete items.
tasksTab.contextMenuList1: Right-click a task or folder in the tree to open the context menu.
tasksTab.contextMenuList2: Available actions: Rename, Add Task, Add Folder, Start Timer, Move to Root, Delete.
tasksTab.contextMenuList3: Folders also have a Save as Template option to save the entire structure.
tasksTab.tagsList1: Create and manage tags in Settings → Tag Manager (name + color).
tasksTab.tagsList2: Assign tags to tasks from the task detail panel.
tasksTab.tagsList3: Use the tag filter at the top of the task tree to show only matching tasks.
tasksTab.templatesList1: Right-click a folder → Save as Template to save its full structure.
tasksTab.templatesList2: Click the template icon in the Projects header to apply a saved template.
tasksTab.templatesList3: Templates duplicate the hierarchy, titles, memos, and work durations.

timerTab.pomodoroList1: The timer follows a WORK → BREAK → LONG BREAK cycle.
timerTab.pomodoroList2: Default: 25 min work, 5 min break, 15 min long break after 4 sessions.
timerTab.startingList1: Click the play button on any task to start a focused session.
timerTab.startingList2: Or go to the Session screen for a free (untied) timer.
timerTab.startingList3: Press <kbd>Space</kbd> to toggle play/pause when not typing.
timerTab.startingList4: Press <kbd>r</kbd> to reset the timer when not typing.
timerTab.modalList1: The timer runs as a modal overlay on top of any screen.
timerTab.modalList2: Close the modal with <kbd>Escape</kbd> — the timer keeps running in the background.
timerTab.modalList3: Press <kbd>{{mod}} + {{shift}} + T</kbd> to toggle the timer modal from any screen.
timerTab.modalList4: A mini timer widget appears in the left sidebar while active.
timerTab.soundMixerList1: The Session screen includes an ambient Sound Mixer.
timerTab.soundMixerList2: Mix multiple background sounds (rain, cafe, etc.) with individual volume controls.
timerTab.soundMixerList3: Sound settings persist across sessions via localStorage.
timerTab.notificationsList1: Enable browser notifications in Settings to get alerted when a session ends.
timerTab.notificationsList2: Notification permission is requested once on toggle.

calendarTab.viewsList1: Switch between Month and Week views using the header toggle.
calendarTab.viewsList2: Navigate months/weeks with the arrow buttons.
calendarTab.viewsList3: Click Today to jump back to the current date.
calendarTab.creatingList1: Click on any day cell to create a new task scheduled for that date.
calendarTab.creatingList2: The task is added to the Inbox and a timer session opens automatically.
calendarTab.displayList1: Tasks with a scheduledAt date appear on their calendar day.
calendarTab.displayList2: Task colors are inherited from their parent folder's color.
calendarTab.displayList3: Click a task chip to navigate to the Tasks view with that task selected.
calendarTab.weekViewList1: The week view shows a time grid with hourly rows.
calendarTab.weekViewList2: Tasks are positioned based on their scheduled time.
calendarTab.weekViewList3: All-day or unscheduled-time tasks appear in the top section.
calendarTab.filteringList1: Use folder tags and colors to visually distinguish task categories.
calendarTab.filteringList2: Only non-deleted tasks with scheduled dates appear on the calendar.
calendarTab.shortcutsList1: <kbd>j</kbd> — Navigate to the next month or week.
calendarTab.shortcutsList2: <kbd>k</kbd> — Navigate to the previous month or week.
calendarTab.shortcutsList4: <kbd>m</kbd> — Toggle between month and week view.

memoTab.dailyList1: Each day has its own memo — one memo per date, automatically created.
memoTab.dailyList2: Use it as a daily journal, quick notes, or meeting log.
memoTab.dailyList3: Memos are saved to the database and persist across sessions.
memoTab.navigationList1: The left panel shows a list of dates with existing memos.
memoTab.navigationList2: Click a date to view or edit that day's memo.
memoTab.navigationList3: Click the Today button to jump to today's memo.
memoTab.navigationList4: Use the + button to create a new memo for today if none exists.
memoTab.editorList1: Memos use the same TipTap rich text editor as task details.
memoTab.editorList2: Type <kbd>/</kbd> to open slash commands (headings, lists, code blocks, etc.).
memoTab.editorList3: See the Editor tab for the full list of slash commands and formatting.
memoTab.calendarIntegrationList1: Days with memos show an indicator dot on the Calendar view.
memoTab.calendarIntegrationList2: Click a memo indicator on the calendar to navigate to that memo.
memoTab.deletingList1: Click the trash icon next to a memo date to delete it.
memoTab.deletingList2: Memo deletion is permanent — deleted memos cannot be restored.

analyticsTab.overviewList1: The Analytics dashboard shows key statistics about your tasks.
analyticsTab.overviewList2: Metrics include: total tasks, completed, in progress, and folder count.
analyticsTab.overviewList3: Data updates in real time as you create, complete, or delete tasks.
analyticsTab.completionList1: View your overall completion rate as a percentage with a progress bar.
analyticsTab.completionList2: A separate today's completion rate tracks daily progress.
analyticsTab.completionList3: Use these metrics to monitor your productivity trends.
analyticsTab.accessingList1: Press <kbd>{{mod}} + 4</kbd> to jump to Analytics from any screen.
analyticsTab.accessingList2: Or click Analytics in the left sidebar.
analyticsTab.accessingList3: Also available via the command palette (<kbd>{{mod}} + K</kbd> → "Analytics").

editorTab.slashCommandsDesc: Type <kbd>/</kbd> in the editor to open the command menu. Start typing to filter commands.
editorTab.markdownShortcutsDesc: The editor supports Markdown-style formatting as you type.
